summary: An email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York reporting that Jeffrey Epstein made a phone call to his girlfriend Kristina Schuliak from custody the previous night. Law enforcement contacted her, she requested a lawyer, and through counsel indicated a willingness to discuss the call's content in exchange for protections.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The incarcerated subject who made a phone call from custody to his girlfriend the night before this email.

persons.name: Kristina Schuliak
persons.context: Described as Epstein's current/latest girlfriend who received a phone call from him while he was in custody; she sought legal counsel and expressed willingness to talk to investigators about the call.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The author of the email, relaying information from law enforcement agents about contact with Epstein's girlfriend and her lawyer.

connections.description: Described as his 'current / latest girlfriend'; he called her from custody.

connections.person2: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The AUSA is relaying information about Schuliak's contact with agents and her lawyer, indicating she is a potential witness in the investigation.

events.title: Epstein's Phone Call from Custody
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein, while in custody, made a phone call to his girlfriend Kristina Schuliak around 7:00 p.m.

events.title: Agents Contact Schuliak
events.description: Law enforcement agents contacted Kristina Schuliak about Epstein's call; she requested a lawyer. Her lawyer subsequently contacted agents, indicating she would discuss the call in exchange for protections.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein made a phone call from custody to his girlfriend Kristina Schuliak on the evening of August 9, 2019.
Law enforcement agents contacted Schuliak about the call, and she requested legal representation.
Schuliak's lawyer communicated that she was willing to tell investigators about the content of the phone call but sought 'some kind of protections' in return.
The communication is an internal email between prosecutors, indicating active investigative follow-up on Epstein's contacts while incarcerated.
The document references a 'new investigation' for which an AUSA needed to be assigned.
